summary: Private internal-use Android business management app (RCS Visual Crafts) built with Flutter, offline-first local storage, featuring authentication, dashboard KPIs, client/order management, daily accounts tracking, and assets tracking.
architectural_notes: Offline-first app using local database (Hive / SharedPreferences)
Android-only distribution via private APK (internal use)
No liabilities module required for now; Firebase may be added later
Documents module needed: store/manage PDF/Word/Excel files (decide local-only vs synced later)
APK distribution must support downloading the latest build from a laptop (not only on-device), via a stable direct link or shared artifact.
known_issues: Current APK download link returns 404 (distribution link broken / file missing or not publicly accessible).

existing_features.title: Implement an internal-only authentication gate using Internet Identity and restrict access to a configurable allowlist of authorized Internet Computer principals (owner + business partners). Unauthorized principals must be blocked from all app pages and backend write/read APIs.

Build a dashboard page that displays: Today’s income, Today’s expenses, Total balance, and a Monthly summary derived from account entries. Values must update after any new income/expense entry is added or edited.

Implement client & order management UI: list/search clients, add a new client, and create/update orders with the required fields (order type, order date, delivery date, amounts, status). Display per-client order history and highlight Pending vs Completed orders.

Implement accounts management UI for daily income and daily expense entries with fields: date, amount, payment mode (Cash/UPI/Bank), notes. Provide a list view with date-range filtering and basic editing capabilities.
Implement an assets module UI to manage a list of business assets (e.g., camera, printer, tools, materials) with quantity and optional value. Provide add/edit and list functionality.

Add offline-first behavior in the web app: cache the latest fetched business data (clients/orders/accounts/assets) locally and allow creating/updating records while offline by queueing changes for sync when connectivity returns. Clearly indicate sync state in English (e.g., 'Offline', 'Syncing', 'Synced', 'Sync failed').

Apply a clean, fast, functionality-first UI theme suitable for a small craft business (warm neutrals, high contrast typography, simple card-based layout). Enforce consistency across pages (spacing, form styles, tables/lists). Avoid blue/purple as primary brand colors.

Add a settings/admin page for managing internal access and basic app metadata: view current signed-in principal, manage allowlisted principals (add/remove), and provide a simple 'Export data' and 'Import data' JSON option for backup/restore.
Add a new Documents page in the frontend that allows authorized users to upload, view, download, and delete PDF/Word/Excel documents.

Integrate the Documents module into the existing React Query data layer and offline-first behavior: document metadata should be cached locally, and uploads/deletes should behave sensibly when offline (queued for sync) with the existing sync-state indicators.
Expose the APK download link in the Settings page for authorized users, with a clear, single-click download action that works on both phone and laptop.

Allow administrators to update the APK download information from the Settings page without code changes (URL + optional version label), and ensure the updated link is immediately reflected in the UI after saving.
Add a basic client-side link health check for the configured APK URL and display an English warning if the link appears broken (e.g., returns 404) so admins can fix it proactively.
Add delete actions in the Clients section so authorized users can delete a client from the Clients list UI, with a confirmation dialog and clear success/error feedback in English.
Add delete actions in the Orders section (client detail orders list) so authorized users can delete an order, with a confirmation dialog and clear success/error feedback in English.
Add delete actions in the Accounts section (daily income/expense entries list) so authorized users can delete a daily entry, with a confirmation dialog and clear success/error feedback in English.
Add delete actions in the Assets section (assets list) so authorized users can delete an asset, with a confirmation dialog and clear success/error feedback in English.

Generate and publish a new Android APK build for the current app version, then configure the app so authorized users can download this APK from a laptop using the existing Settings → Android App download section (no 404/broken link).

Ensure authorized users can download the latest Android APK from the Settings page by configuring a stable, publicly reachable direct-download APK URL (no 404) and a version label in the existing APK Download section.

Ensure the Settings → Android App download section provides a working, stable, publicly reachable direct-download APK URL (no 404) so authorized users can download the APK successfully from both laptop and phone.

Keep (or adjust if currently incorrect) the admin update flow for APK download info so an administrator can quickly update APK URL and version label from the Settings page, with clear English validation and error messages.
Ensure the APK link health check status shown in the Android App section accurately reflects the current configured URL and updates after an admin saves a new URL.

new_feature_requests.summary: Authentication: simple login system restricted to authorized internal users
Dashboard showing today’s income, today’s expenses, total balance, and monthly summary
Client & order management: add clients with contact details, order type, dates, amounts (total/advance/balance), and status (Pending/Completed)
Accounts management: daily income/expense entries with date, amount, payment mode (Cash/UPI/Bank), and notes
Assets module: list assets with quantity and optional value
Offline-first local data storage using Hive/SharedPreferences (Firebase can be added later)
Android-only scope with APK output; clean UI focused on speed and functionality over design

Create the core backend data model and CRUD APIs for: (a) clients + orders, (b) daily account entries (income/expense), and (c) assets. Persist all data in the single Motoko canister actor and expose typed methods for the frontend to query and mutate records.
Add a Documents section to store and manage PDF, Word, and Excel files within the app

Implement backend support for a new Documents module that stores files and their metadata, accessible only to authorized users (same authorization rules as existing clients/orders/accounts/assets APIs).
Provide a reliable way to generate and share a fresh APK download link (so users can download on phone/laptop without 404 errors)

Add backend support for storing and retrieving the current Android APK download information (at minimum: APK download URL, version label/text, and last-updated timestamp) so the app can always display the latest working APK link.
Add delete functionality across all sections/modules (e.g., clients, orders, accounts entries, assets, documents) so users can remove records
Ensure backend delete behavior is consistent for client deletion by preventing or handling orphaned records (orders linked to a deleted client) in a predictable way.
Generate the latest APK build for the current app version and provide a working download method that can be accessed from a laptop (direct APK file/link).
